title: A Keen remix I made
content:
I made a remix of "You've Got To Eat Your Vegetables". You can check it out [url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/audio/EatYourVeggiesRemix.mp3]here[/url] if you're interested.------------------
[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/] My website[/url]
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: Re: A Keen remix I made
content: Pretty sweet! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]   Kinda repetitive, but great otherwise.[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: A Keen remix I made
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Pretty sweet! Kinda repetitive, but great otherwise. [hr][/quote]

Thanks. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Yeah, it is a bit repetetive. Maybe I should have put a few more variations in it.------------------
[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/] My website[/url]
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: Re: A Keen remix I made
content:
Cool, never too many Keen mixes! Sounds interesting. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Another one...
content:
Here's another remix I made today.

[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/audio/TooHotRemix.mp3]Remix of "Too Hot" (pyramid music and maybe some other levels from Keen 4)[/url]------------------
[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/] My website[/url]
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: Re: Another one...
content:
Ugh, the "Eat Your Veggies" mix was kinda annoying. Not enough going on in any of the instruments and throughout the entire song (tone up, tone down, etc etc etc), and the combination of instruments doesn't really fit (square wave + harpsichord?).

Too Hot is a lot better, but the underlying melody drowns out the main melody, and the orchestra hit would have been better off every measure (or two) instead of every beat.____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Another one...
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]the underlying melody drowns out the main melody[hr][/quote]

You mean the one on the strings? Yeah, I think I might have used too much reverb on that. Or do you mean the bass part?

[quote]Quote:[hr]the orchestra hit would have been better off every measure (or two) instead of every beat. [hr][/quote]

It isn't on every beat, in fact I think it's only once per bar...------------------
[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/] My website[/url]
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: Re: Another one...
content:
Woops, yeah, that's what I meant. Every 4 or 8 measures instead of every measure.____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Another one...
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Woops, yeah, that's what I meant. Every 4 or 8 measures instead of every measure. [hr][/quote]

Ah, I see. Unfortunately I can't edit it now, since the shareware version of the music program I was using only lets me save MP3s, not projects. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] ------------------
[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/] My website[/url]
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: Re: Another one...
content:
That's gotta be Fruityloops/FL Studio. You should try something free, like [url=http://psycle.pastnotecut.org/]Psycle[/url]. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] ____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Another one...
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]That's gotta be Fruityloops/FL Studio. You should try something free, like Psycle. [hr][/quote]

Can it use VST plugins/instruments and soundfonts?

Edit: It says it does have VST support. Maybe I should check this out...------------------
[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/] My website[/url]
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: Re: Another one...
content:
VSTs, own "machines", samplers all work. Soundfonts, I'm not sure, but there might be a "machine" or VST to do it for you.

Oh wait... I do know of a soundfont VST. Lemme look up the name later.____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Another one...
content:
I like the Too Hot remix.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Another one...
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Oh wait... I do know of a soundfont VST. Lemme look up the name later. [hr][/quote]

Thanks. I find Psycle's interface a bit less convenient than FL Studio's, but maybe that's because I'm not so used to using trackers, which the sequencer seems to resemble. Anyway, I'll spend some more time playing around with it and see what I think then.


[quote]Quote:[hr]I like the Too Hot remix. [hr][/quote]

Thanks. I've thought about maybe doing remixes of the entire Keen soundtrack, but I'm not sure if I will or not. Hey, I've just thought, maybe Keen Community Remix Project could be a good idea...
------------------
[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/] My website[/url]
[url=http://ericmushroom.livejournal.com/]My stupid journal thing[/url]

title: Re: Another one...
content:
Yeah, sounds great with a "Keen Community Remix Project ", and the greatest part with it is gonna be that I am going to participate [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] (At last, something I can take part of :P).
Sounds like a good idea. :3

title: fsdaoij
content: drums in "eat" were a little extravagant
